intro: Phlomoides longidentata, commonly known as the long-toothed phlomoides, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, tubular flowers that are typically purple or violet in color. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often covered with fine hairs. Phlomoides longidentata is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive appearance and ability to thrive in well-drained soils.
